JUDGES: Antonella Mularoni;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in Uşak . She was represented before the ORG by Mr Atak , a lawyer practising in Uşak . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant was the owner of a building in Uşak . On an unspecified date , she agreed to sell this building to GPE and in exchange she received a certain amount of cash and CARDINAL bonds dated DATE and DATE respectively . She accordingly transferred the title deed to PERSON ’s name . Shortly after this transaction , PERSON sold the building to a certain ORG and the title was registered in the latter ’s name .

On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer filed an action before ORG against GPE and ORG , arguing that PERSON had deceived the applicant during the transaction , and thus the transfer of the title deed should be annulled and the title re - registered in her name . In this respect , she claimed that PERSON had committed fraud during the purchase of the land . In the meantime , the applicant also initiated criminal proceedings against PERSON in ORG , accusing him of fraud ( case no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

On DATE ORG held its first hearing and took statements from several witnesses . The court also took note of the fact that there were CARDINAL separate criminal proceedings pending against PERSON on charges of fraud ( namely case no . CARDINAL initiated by the applicant before ORG ; case no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL initiated by a certain PERSON before ORG and case no . CARDINAL before ORG ) . It therefore decided to request copies of these case files which were found to be relevant to the instant case .
Thereafter , the civil court awaited the outcome of these criminal proceedings , each time adjourning the hearings to a later date and without taking any decision on the merits of the case .
PERSON was subsequently acquitted of the charges against him in all CARDINAL cases and ORG received copies of the relevant case files and judgments on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE respectively .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s case . In taking this decision , the court based itself on the acquittal decision delivered by the criminal court in case no . CARDINAL . The court also held that there was nothing in the case file to suggest that the defendants had not acted in good faith during the transaction .
On DATE ORG , after holding a hearing on the merits of the case , upheld the judgment of DATE .
On DATE ORG further dismissed the applicant ’s request for rectification .
